title: Takayuki Chano
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Chano was born in <a href="Ichikawa%2C%20Chiba">Ichikawa</a> on 23 November 1976. After graduating from high school, he joined his local club <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">JEF United Ichihara</a> (later "JEF United Chiba") in 1995. He played many matches as center back from 1998. The club won second place in the <a href="1998%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1998 Emperor's Cup</a>. The club also won third place in the <a href="2001%20J.League%20Division%201">2001</a> and <a href="2003%20J.League%20Division%201">2003 J1 League</a>. He moved to <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a> with teammate <a href="Shinji%20Murai">Shinji Murai</a> in 2005. He played many matches as center back with <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> player <a href="Makoto%20Tanaka">Makoto Tanaka</a>. He left the club with Murai at the end of the 2009 season for a generational change and he returned to JEF United Chiba with Murai in 2010. He retired at the end of the 2011 season.
National team career.
On 25 April 2004, Chano debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Hungary%20national%20football%20team">Hungary</a>. In July, he was elected Japan for <a href="2004%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2004 Asian Cup</a>. At this tournament, although he did not play in the match, Japan won the champions. He also played at <a href="2005%20FIFA%20Confederations%20Cup">2005 Confederations Cup</a>. He played 7 games for Japan until 2005.
